instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 3437-B Vcore no boot
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that has 1.7v on Vcore <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> is missing <SIGNAL>SPI_MLB_CLK</SIGNAL> when <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> is off the board i get that signal all spi resistors look good no shorts found on chip lines

threads.title: 3437-B Vcore no boot
threads.message:
"when <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> is off the board"
Did you really test the board without BIOS chip???
What do you expect to find?

When PCH takes access to BIOS, some pins go down to 0V (as normal).
If you really want to see what happens there, need an o-scope.

Try known good working BIOS file, clean ME.

threads.title: 3437-B Vcore no boot
threads.message: Tried clean ME no change am i using oscope to confirm communication on those pins

threads.title: 3437-B Vcore no boot
threads.message: Did you clean ME on your BIOS; doesn't help in this case.

threads.title: 3437-B Vcore no boot
threads.message: I found a file on the forum that i used

threads.title: 3437-B Vcore no boot
threads.message: Not much just liquid damage put through ultrasonic

threads.title: 3437-B Vcore no boot
threads.message:
Heat BGA chips with quality flux; try to "burn" eventually accumulated crap.
Better to reball SMC.

Inspect board for broken traces, or knocked off components.
UC can cause this, especially if no sweep funcion available.
